recipesJson.name: The Glazed Doughnut by BrinNutz, Revised
recipesJson.author: ID10-T
recipesJson.description: BrinNutz's donut was wonderful, a real breakthrough. But it had a very slight fermented-type off note for me and was a little nutty. Reducing %'s got rid of that stale-beerish flavor and left behind only a mouthwatering plain glazed donut.

reviews.text: This juice has been steeping for 4 weeks on my shelf and I don't know what to say, the only thing it tastes of is yeast. I couldn't vape it and I'm sorry about that because I was very much looking forward to it.

Vaping this now after a 2 week steep.  Was kind of afraid of the high percentage of Joy, but it works here.  It's a good basic doughnut flavor and seems like it could be modified to add fruit pretty easily.  It's true to its name though.  The only critique I could add is it tastes a little like a mix between a glazed doughnut and glazed bread.  The Joy always tastes like that to me though so I'd still definitely recommend it to anyone looking for this profile.  Most doughnuts I've tried have fruit and rely too much on the fruit flavor and the doughnut flavor gets washed away so props for making a straight plain one.  There is a hint of the bavarian cream that comes through too which is nice.

pageContext.name: The Glazed Doughnut by BrinNutz, Revised
